meanings.definition: A substance used to repel or drive away insects or other pests.
meanings.sent1: I sprayed some repellants to keep the mosquitoes away.
meanings.sent2: The store sells various types of repellants for different pests.
meanings.sent3: The ants took one whiff of the repellants and decided to have a picnic elsewhere.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a powerful repellants, driving away all the sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The repellants created an invisible shield, protecting the plants from hungry insects.

meanings.definition: Something that causes disgust or aversion.
meanings.sent1: The slimy texture of the food was a strong repellants for him.
meanings.sent2: The foul smell of the garbage acted as a natural repellants to keep animals away.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs was a repellants to most of the students, except for Timmy.
meanings.sent4: The dark, murky water was a repellants to the swimmers, hinting at hidden dangers below.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the abandoned house was a repellants to anyone brave enough to enter.
